newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico to remain net sugar exporter - Pinto.
newsitem.headline: Mexico to remain net sugar exporter - Pinto.

text.p: Mexico has turned the corner and become a net sugar exporter and the scenario is unlikley to change, one of the country's top industrialists said here Wednesday.

"We have enetered an export phase and we will continue to be exporters," Jose Pinto Mazal, director of the sugar mill owners Grupo Beta San Miguel, told the F.O. Licht World Sugar and Sweetners' Conference.

Pinto, also a vice-president of the National Sugar Chamber, showed slides of the chamber's estimates for exports this year. THe 1997 estimate for exports is 700,000 tonnes, against 658,704 tonnes in 1996 and 230,459 tonnes in 1995.
That, he said, compared to imports of a predicted 290,000 tonnes this year, 250,538 tonnes in 1996 and 28,082 tonnes in 1995.
Earlier at the conference, Mexico's Trade Minitser Herminio Blanco predicted Mexico would export 600,000 tonnes this year.
Mexico has traditionally hovered between being a net importer and exporter, largely because of production fluctuations and high per capita consumption.
